meanings.definition: A unit of weight in ancient Israel, equal to about 0.57 grams.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Israel, merchants used gerahs to measure small amounts of goods.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists found a collection of gerahs in the excavation site.
meanings.sent3: The tiny gerahs decided to have a race to see who was the fastest weight!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as light as a gerahs, yet strong enough to carry her through.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering gerahs sparkled in the sunlight, a precious relic of the past.
